frameDefinitions: A group of Arguers (also expressible as Arguer1 and Arguer2) express incompatible opinions or beliefs about an Issue.
An Entity is in a state such that it participates in a preponderance of states and events which are desirable for it.
The words in this frame involve an Undesirable_event which affects the Patient negatively.
The lexical units in this frame have to do with an Entity being in a State of order or disorder.
An Item is attached by a Handle, via a Connector, to a Goal, or Items are attached to each other.
A generally large group of people, the Combatants, are engaged in a chaotic, violent, and usually protracted Fight amongst themselves.
frameExamples: We <t>bickered</t> about semantics for an hour.
In the 1920s the peach industry <t>flourished</t> in Upson County.
The first <t>calamity</t> was a disastrous trade war with Holland.
Soon the system was in total <t><fex name='St'>chaos</fex></t>.
My thumb was <t>stuck</t> to the tube of glue.
listRoleDefinitions: A group of people in an argument.
A person who is arguing with Arguer2.
The person who is being argued with by <fen>Arguer1</fen>.
The the thing the the <fen>Arguers</fen> are arguing over or about.
The time when the argument takes place.
The location at which the <fen>Arguers</fen> quarrel
The <t>Entity</t> is experiencing a period of desirable events or states.
This role describes the state of the <fen>Entity</fen>. It is often incorporated into the LUs of this frame.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> thrives.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the thriving takes place.
The undesirable event which occurs.
The entity that experiences the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen>.
When the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> occurs.
Where the <fen>Undesirable_Event</fen> takes place.
The object or phenomenon which exists in the <fen>State</fen> of disorder.  It is common for the <fen>Entity</fen> to be null instantiated in this frame.
The <fen>State</fen> in which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists.  Usually the <fen>State</fen> will be the target-denoting noun.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> exists in the <fen>State</fen>.
<fen>Connector</fen> identifies the instrument used to attach and is usually expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.
<fen>Item</fen> identifies the entity that comes to be attached to the <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Items</fen> identifies the plural items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment.
<fen>Goal</fen> identifies the location to which the <fen>Item</fen>(s) is attached.
The <fen>Combatants</fen> participate as fighters in the <fen>Fight</fen>.
The violent activity.
When the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
Where the <fen>Fight</fen> takes place.
listRoleExamples: In the 1920s <fex>the peach industry</fex> thrived in Upson County.
He was living <fex>well</fex> after his promotion.
<fex>In the 1920s</fex> the peach industry thrived in Upson County.
Why was it that democracy flourished <fex>in America</fex>?
An <fex>environmental</fex> disaster is just what we need.
Subsequent bomb alerts caused <fex>travel</fex>chaos in the London Underground.
More <fex>chaos</fex> awaits the Soviet Union unless it ditches perestroika for a Thatcherite purge of its economy.
Monica Lewinksy in 1998 gave him a rich new target, as did the electoral chaos <fex>of 2000</fex>.
Lying in bed listening to the chaos <fex>downstairs</fex>, he knew his conquest had only been temporary.
The tarp is  tied down <fex>with a rope</fex>.
<fex>A handle</fex>  was affixed to the door.
The boat remained anchored <fex>to the coastline</fex>.
The football referee's controversial call led to a bloody free-for-all <fex>among the fans</fex>.
I couldn't help but watch as several bruised people reentered the <fex><t>melee</t></fex>.
